timeline.message:
Mutiple metrics fixes

 - Allow lists of publishers to be set.

   Allow setting of metric pubishers to be set on the client of request override
   rather than a single publisher, making using multiple MetricPublishers per
   client or request easier.

 - Remove any non-core usage of MetricUtils.

 - Fix metrics test in TranscribeStreamIntegrationTest.

timeline.author: zoewangg

timeline.bodyText: Out of curiosity, why do we move this method out of  MetricUtils?
timeline.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: Discussed this with @millems. MetricUtils is @SdkInternal, and we'd rather keep it that way than expose it as a protected API.
replies.author: dagnir

timeline.bodyText: minor: missing fail("no exception thrown"), same as other tests.
timeline.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: Is this necessary? It doesn't really matter if an exception is thrown or not; the test is just just checking that the right publishers are being used based on configuration. It just happens to throw here because the mock isn't fully set up
replies.author: dagnir

replies.bodyText: oh okay, I misread the test. We don't need it in this case
replies.author: zoewangg

timeline.message:
Mutiple metrics fixes

 - Allow lists of publishers to be set.

   Allow setting of metric pubishers to be set on the client of request override
   rather than a single publisher, making using multiple MetricPublishers per
   client or request easier.

 - Remove any non-core usage of MetricUtils.

 - Fix metrics test in TranscribeStreamIntegrationTest.

Mutiple metrics fixes

 - Allow lists of publishers to be set.

   Allow setting of metric pubishers to be set on the client of request override
   rather than a single publisher, making using multiple MetricPublishers per
   client or request easier.

 - Remove any non-core usage of MetricUtils.

 - Fix metrics test in TranscribeStreamIntegrationTest.

 - Fix Async API call metric stage to add the duration in a separate
   CompletionStage.
